subject: Re: [junit] problems running junit with ant
msgSnippet: ... Start by hardcoding all the paths directly in your  task, then get that working. Once that works, replace the hardcoded values with Ant properties,
messageBody:
nathan wrote:
> I keep running into the same problem when i try to run junit. I keep
> getting the following error:
>
> [junit] Class not found edu.ggu.cis330.webclient.config.TestMain
>
> the target i am using in ant looks like this:
>
> <target name="test" description="Test with JUnit" depends="compile">
> <mkdir dir="${dir.test}"/>
> <java
> classname="junit.textui.TestRunner"
> taskname="junit"
> fork="true">
> <arg value="${test.classpath}.TestMain"/>
> <classpath refid="classpath"/>
> </java>
> </target>
>
> the test.classpath path is in the refid "classpath"
>
> i tried creating the target using <junit> instead of <java> and the
> error said that the task could not be found. there was a list of
> things it said to do before consulting a mailing list, but i didnt
> see how any of the errors mentioned pertained to me.
>
> thanks for any help with this.

Start by hardcoding all the paths directly in your <java> task, then get
that working. Once that works, replace the hardcoded values with Ant
properties, slowly, one by one.

I find that always solves the problem.
